billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Requires the inclusion of certain information in fiscal notes in retirement bills and on bills affecting political subdivisions
summary: Requires the inclusion of certain information in fiscal notes in retirement bills and on bills affecting political subdivisions; provides that fiscal note measurements shall be made in units of money, personal services, equipment, or any appropriate, convenient or accessible units and measurement.

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Investigations and Govern-
         ment Operations

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in relation to requiring the inclu-
         sion of certain information in fiscal notes in retirement bills and on
         bills affecting political subdivisions

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 50 of the legislative law, as added by chapter 503
    2  of the laws of 1971, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 50. Fiscal note in retirement bills. A bill which enacts  or  amends
    4  any  provision  of  law  relating  to a retirement system or plan of the
    5  state of New York or of any of its political subdivisions shall  contain
    6  a fiscal note stating the estimated annual cost to the employer affected
    7  and  the  source of such estimate, AND A STATEMENT IDENTIFYING THE INDI-
    8  VIDUAL OR ENTITY THAT PROVIDED COMPENSATION TO THE SOURCE OF SUCH  ESTI-
    9  MATE, IF ANY.
   10    S 2. Section 51 of the legislative law, as added by chapter 985 of the
   11  laws of 1983, is amended to read as follows:
   12    S 51. Fiscal  impact  notes on bills affecting political subdivisions.
   13  1. For the purpose of this section,  the  term  "political  subdivision"
   14  means  any  county,  city, town, village, HAMLET, special district [or],
   15  school district, COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR ANY  STATE  AGENCY,  DEPARTMENT,
   16  OFFICE, COMMISSION, BUREAU OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY. AS USED IN THIS SECTION,
   17  SPECIAL  DISTRICT SHALL MEAN A DISTRICT POSSESSING THE POWER TO CONTRACT
   18  INDEBTEDNESS AND LEVY OR REQUIRE THE TAXES OR BENEFIT  ASSESSMENTS  UPON
   19  REAL PROPERTY.
   20    2.  [The  legislature shall by concurrent resolution of the senate and
   21  assembly prescribe rules requiring fiscal notes to accompany, on a sepa-
   22  rate form, bills and amendments to bills, except as otherwise prescribed
   23  by such rules,] PRIOR TO DISCHARGING A BILL  which  would  substantially

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07826-01-1

       S. 2610                             2

    1  affect  the revenues or expenses, or both, BY AT LEAST TWO HUNDRED FIFTY
    2  THOUSAND DOLLARS, of any political subdivision, ALL STANDING LEGISLATIVE
    3  COMMITTEES SHALL PREPARE A FISCAL NOTE FOR EACH SUCH BILL.  SUCH  FISCAL
    4  NOTE SHALL BE INCLUDED IN SUCH BILL AND DETAIL THE FOLLOWING:
    5    (A)  AN  ESTIMATED COST OR SAVINGS TO THE STATE AND AFFECTED POLITICAL
    6  SUBDIVISION FOR THE FIVE  YEARS FOLLOWING ADOPTION OF SUCH BILL; AND
    7    (B) THE SOURCE OF THE ESTIMATE DESCRIBED  IN  PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF  THIS
    8  SUBDIVISION  AND  A  STATEMENT IDENTIFYING ANY INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY THAT
    9  PROVIDED COMPENSATION TO THE SOURCE OF SUCH ESTIMATE, IF ANY.
   10    3. THE FISCAL IMPACTS DESCRIBED IN SUCH FISCAL NOTES  SHALL  BE  ESTI-
   11  MATED ON A BASIS OR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:
   12    (A) INDIVIDUAL POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS; OR
   13    (B)  AGGREGATES  OF  POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS (I) STATEWIDE OR BY LESSER
   14  GEOGRAPHIC AREA, OR (II) BY CLASSIFICATION OR SUBCLASSIFICATION OR RELE-
   15  VANT CHARACTERISTICS; OR
   16    (C) REPRESENTATIVE POLITICAL  SUBDIVISIONS  WITH  RELEVANT  CHARACTER-
   17  ISTICS  THEREOF  QUANTITATIVELY SET FORTH E.G. POPULATION, AREA, WEIGHED
   18  AVERAGE DAILY ATTENDANCE OF PUPILS.
   19    4. FISCAL NOTE MEASUREMENTS SHALL BE MADE IN UNITS OF MONEY,  PERSONAL
   20  SERVICES,  EQUIPMENT, OR ANY OTHER APPROPRIATE, CONVENIENT OR ACCESSIBLE
   21  UNITS OF MEASUREMENT.
   22    5. THE SPONSOR OF SUCH BILL OR THE CHAIR  OR  RANKING  MEMBER  OF  ANY
   23  STANDING  LEGISLATIVE  COMMITTEE  ARE  AUTHORIZED TO PREPARE SUCH FISCAL
   24  NOTE IN COLLABORATION WITH THE DIVISION OF THE BUDGET OR THE  DEPARTMENT
   25  OR  AGENCY OF STATE GOVERNMENT CHARGED WITH THE FISCAL DUTIES, FUNCTIONS
   26  OR POWERS PROVIDED IN SUCH BILL.
   27    OFFICERS OF EXECUTIVE  BRANCH  ENTITIES  SHALL  PROCESS  REQUESTS  FOR
   28  ASSISTANCE IN PREPARING FISCAL NOTES ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVE BASIS,
   29  EXCEPT  PRIORITY SHALL BE GIVEN TO PROCESSING REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE IN
   30  PREPARING FISCAL NOTES FROM THE CHAIRS OR RANKING MEMBERS OF THE  SENATE
   31  FINANCE COMMITTEE OR ASSEMBLY WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE.
   32    [3.]  6.  Fiscal  notes shall not, however, be required for bills: (a)
   33  subject to the provisions of section fifty of this [chapter] ARTICLE, or
   34  (b) accompanied by special home rule  requests  submitted  by  political
   35  subdivisions,  or (c) which provide discretionary authority to political
   36  subdivisions, or (d) submitted pursuant to section  twenty-four  of  the
   37  state finance law.
   38    [4.]  7.  If  the estimate or estimates contained in a fiscal note are
   39  inaccurate, such inaccuracies shall not  affect,  impair  or  invalidate
   40  such bill.
   41    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   42  have become a law.
